private_information: I may move disks A B C D E
I can only move disks if they are at the top of a peg and the move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks A B C D E

private_information: I may move disks F G H I J
I can only move disks if they are at the top of a peg and the move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks F G H I J

private_information: I may move disks K L M N O
I can only move disks if they are at the top of a peg and the move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal configuration is reached while only moving disks K L M N O

private_information: I coordinate and integrate partial plans from the three agents
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent plans into a correct multi-agent plan and output a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, D; right peg top-to-bottom B.

Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, a move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg, and no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents are restricted to moving only specific subsets of disks: agent_1 moves A B C D E, agent_2 moves F G H I J, agent_3 moves K L M N O.
All agents must respect the top-of-peg constraint and size ordering when proposing moves.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from pegP to pegQ'. Ensure each proposed move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves a disk if it is currently at the top of its peg. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on the moves that involve the disks assigned to you and that are consistent with the public initial configuration and goal configuration.
plan.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves in the specified format. If you cannot determine some context, only propose moves that are valid given what you know.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and may only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from pegP to pegQ'. Ensure each proposed move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves a disk if it is currently at the top of its peg. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on the moves that involve the disks assigned to you and that are consistent with the public initial configuration and goal configuration.
plan.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves in the specified format. If you cannot determine some context, only propose moves that are valid given what you know.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and may only move disks K, L, M, N, O. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_3: move disk X from pegP to pegQ'. Ensure each proposed move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves a disk if it is currently at the top of its peg. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on the moves that involve the disks assigned to you and that are consistent with the public initial configuration and goal configuration.
plan.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves in the specified format. If you cannot determine some context, only propose moves that are valid given what you know.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the partial ordered move lists from the three agents into a single consistent multi-agent plan and then produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the integrated solution for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of different agents distinct and maintain the primitive-move granularity. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with the FastDownwards solver and encodes the Tower of Hanoi rules, the per-agent move permissions, the initial configuration, and the goal configuration. If there are naming inconsistencies across agent plans, resolve them transparently and document the mapping before the PDDL sections.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the three agents' ordered move lists. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Agent plans: {plan_agent_1} {plan_agent_2} {plan_agent_3}. Integrate these lists into a single ordered plan that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk-move permissions. Then emit a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted to FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
